name: The Crash Test Dummies: God Shuffled His Feet Quiz | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: In "God Shuffled His Feet", what color hair did the boy have?
questions.explanation:
Blue.

	God tells a parable in regards to all the questions he's getting. Of course, it doesn't answer anything.

questions.text: What playwright is mentioned in "Afternoons and Coffeespoons"?
questions.explanation:
Sartre.

	"Times is when the day is like a play by Sartre When it seems a bookburning's in perfect order." Jean-Paul Sartre worked during World War II. One of his famous plays is the disturbing "No Exit".

questions.text: In "In The Days of the Caveman", you use sharpened tools in lieu of what?
questions.explanation:
Hotplates.

	"When you go on camping trips you're stuck right out in natureForaging the forests like a primateUsing sharpened tools instead of hotplates."

questions.text: What painting is used as the album cover?
options: Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grand Jatte
questions.explanation:
Bacchus and Ariadne.

	Bacchus and Ariadne was painted by Titian from 1520-1523 using oil on canvas. Titian was a Italian painter who died in 1576.

questions.text: Where does the music video to "Afternoons and Coffeespoons" take place?
questions.explanation:
A hospital.

	With a lyric such as "I've heard the rattle in my bronchi", it is logical that the song take place in a hospital. In the music video, lead singer Brad Roberts is a patient who is operated on by the other members of the band.

questions.text: According to "How Does a Duck Know?", who will smack your face?
questions.explanation:
The human race.

	"How Does a Duck Know?" is my favorite song on the album. One verse is as follows: "When everything seems planned out,when everything seems nicely planned out,well the human race will come and smack your face!"

questions.text: In "When I Go Out With Artists", two of the art movements mentioned are cubism and dadaism.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Dadaism was a post-World War I art movement that reacted to the enormous human toll of that war. Cubism was best personified by Pablo Picasso.

questions.text: Complete the song title: "_______ Knights and Maidens".
questions.explanation:
Two & 2.

	"Two Knights and Maidens" describes two knights who drank hallucinogenic potions given to them by the maidens. When tigers encountered the two knights, they merely laughed, for they thought the tigers were another hallucination.

questions.text: According to "In The Days of the Caveman", what served as human's food?
questions.explanation:
Bugs and Trees.

	"Bugs and trees were your food then, No pyjamas or doctors."

questions.text: Complete this lyric: "Running into you like this without warning/ Is like a whiff of _______________ in the morning."
questions.explanation:
Tequila.

	This is from "I Think I'll Disappear Now", a melancholy song that foreshadowed many songs from the Crash Test Dummies' later album "Puss 'n' Boots".
